Stayed a few nights
review_text:
If you're looking for a charming and comfortable getaway near UC Santa Cruz, (we came here for our sonâ€™s graduation), look no further than Mermaid Cottage. From the moment we arrived, we knew we were in for a relaxing stay. The self-check-in process was a breeze with the lockbox and easy to follow instructions from the host.
The atmosphere of the cottage was incredibly relaxing, and we particularly enjoyed the back deck. The kitchen was fully equipped with everything we needed to prepare meals, and the coffee maker was a delightful bonus. While we brought our own favorite morning coffee, we were pleasantly surprised to find that the coffee maker could also grind coffee beans.
When we inquired about hosting our two sons who live in the area for lunch, the host Ciara promptly responded and allowed us to do so.
Overall, our experience at Mermaid Cottage was fantastic. It provided a comfortable and convenient base for our visit to UC Santa Cruz, and we appreciated the thoughtful amenities

review_text:
Awesome place! You should consider it as a unique experience, not as a luxury hotel. It's inconvenient to get down the ladder if you want to go to a toilet, you won't want to shower if it's chilly outside, but it's definitely worth it to stay there for a night. The tree house is a beautiful piece of art and engineering, the place is amazing, you are right in the middle of a redwood forest. It's super quiet, it was a pleasure to wake up there in the morning and look at the redwoods through your ceiling and walls. When we stayed there the weather was quite chilly, around 10C/50F at night. But an electric blanket worked very well, we even turned it off because it was too hot at max power.
The only downside was an almost finished toilet paper roll that ended right in the middle of a business, and there were no replacement at all! Luckily we had one in a car, but that's not what you expect paying 1k for a night.

review_text: My partner and I had a great stay at the Pinecone despite it being rainy! Check in was very unique because our host (Amber) kept good communication and was flexible on having us check in past the 4pm period. The rundown was very easy to understand the safety of going up and down the Pinecone. The inside was pretty clean for a treehouse and the windows were clear enough to enjoy the scenery. the bed was comfortable and had heated blankets. (I ended up getting too hot in the middle of the night!) Waking up was amazing to hear the birds and have the trees surrounding you. We didn't get to use the shower but the bathroom system was maintained well. There is a light above the stairs so if you had to wake up in the middle of the night and crawl down, you would be able to find your way down. The only heads up I will give to others that need to pee a lot is try to plan your trips so you don't go back and forth! Great experience & would be willing to come back!

Stayed one night
review_text:
As an avid traveler, I always look forward to unique accommodations, which is why I chose the treehouse. The concept when you arrive is genuinely breathtaking. However, my excitement was short lived when entering this architectural marvel.
The first thing you notice was the visible wear and tear. Insulation tapes hung loosely from the windows, a seemingly easy fix that was inexplicably ignored. Several windows were chipped, and a few light bulbs were out. It's disheartening to find such neglect in a place unique like this one.
Furthermore, the heater, vital for a comfortable stay, failed within half a day. This lack of maintenance doesn't just dampen the experience; it raises concerns about what else might be overlooked, unsettling for anyone hoping for a peaceful night rest.
Now, if your goal is to impress your social media followers with stunning visuals, then this treehouse will check your box.
However, for $800+ you can have a 5-star experience at many hotels with breakfast. ğŸ¤·ğŸ¼â€â™‚ï¸

review_text:
Our overnight stay in the Pinecone was nothing short of magical.
We stayed during the rain, but that made for a more beautiful retreat being indoors hearing the rain trickling all night and into the early misty and mystical morning watching the fog pierce the trees surrounding us. The string lights, which are dimmable, make for the ultimate fairytale-feeling ambiance in this treehouse, along with the cute hanging plants on the windows.
Our trek to the bathroom was quite frequent as we enjoyed wine and hot cocoa in the Pinecone all night, but it was a fun and scenic journey up and down the ladder even through the light rain.
Iâ€™d say the underdog of this whole place has got to be the bathroom. Itâ€™s a separate unit with a large window that opens to your own private forest view that makes you truly feel like youâ€™re out in the wilderness. The bathroom supplies a hot rainfall shower with probably the best direct forest view you can ever get.
Thanks o2 treehouse for the memories!

review_text: My wife and I booked the Pinecone on a whim for our 17th anniversary, and it was well worth it. It was such a unique place to stay. We stayed on a rainy, foggy night in December, and the sound of the rain and gentle sway in the wind was so peaceful. The 360-degree views were amazing, not to mention looking up at the treetops, clouds, and stars (when we were lucky enough to have breaks in the clouds). We were a little worried about staying warm due to the season and weather, but the small propane heater kept the interior at a comfortable temperature. Climbing the 30-foot ladder was not for the faint of heart, but was so much fun. The option to open the sliding doors on the bathroom to have a more open-air shower was a great feature. We went to dinner in Felton, which was only a short 15-minute drive, and the trip into Santa Cruz the next morning was about the same. We loved everything about our stay, and we'll remember it for the rest of our lives.

review_text: An extremely unique place to stay! The treehouse is in a quiet location. Appreciate the natural surroundings and the modern convenience of the bathroom/shower just below the treehouse. The bed is very comfortable and loved staring up and out the ceiling at the trees. There was just a bit of rain during the night and the sound of the rain hitting the trees was so relaxing. There is a grill and picnic table so be sure to bring your picnic supplies. We grilled burgers for dinner. Our host for the evening was Abi who was super helpful with getting us some supplies we needed to make dinner. She also met us at the gate to the entrance of the property and escorted us to the treehouse, making check-in super easy! Thank you for a memorable stay.

review_text: I had been trying to book the treehouse for over a year when all of a sudden a date opened up and for our anniversary no less! We couldn't have planned it better! We had such a great anniversary weekend in Santa Cruz. First ziplining in Mount Hermon, then staying at the treehouse and finally a tour at the Lick Observatory. We appreciated being able to check in an hour early right after ziplining. Alastair was very responsive and accommodating! The treehouse was as magical as we expected. The smell of the composting toilet was a little stronger than we hoped for but luckily it was warm enough to leave the windows open which helped. We had everything we needed for a wonderful anniversary and it was definitely worth the wait!

The place itself is simply beautiful and has a magical touch that captivated us. We are genuinely happy to have had the opportunity to be there and enjoy its serene and peaceful ambiance, from the day to the night when the sky looked breathtaking.
While our stay was wonderful, we believe that, considering the price, some additional amenities could be added to further enhance the experience. For example, having a mini-refrigerator would be great, and perhaps a small gesture like a chocolate on the bed would be a lovely touch. However, overall, we are very satisfied and happy with our stay.
We sincerely thank you for providing us with such a special and memorable experience!

review_text: First, the concept is wonderful and unique. I give it A+ for this creativity and my husband who IS a glamper while I am a camper, was really looking forward to this stay. Unfortunately we spent the night wide awake till 3am thanks to a house nearby (according to the host) that was playing incredibly loud clanging music till that time. I have audio recordings of this and messaged Airbnb and my host at 11pm, 1am and finally 3am (to airbnb requesting a partial refund because I was so mad). Imagine paying $800 for this stay and not being able to enjoy the peace and quiet in the woods? It just seemed like a cruel joke. Bed was saggy surprisingly - most glamping Ive stayed at the beds are comfy. You have to bring your own fuel for the stove. And in the middle of soaping myself, hot water turned icy cold. $800 for this does not make sense to me. The host offered me an extra night (thank u!!) but had to leave since we had plans. She refunded me $200 (thank you)! - Appreciate the gesture!

Itâ€™s an unparalleled experience in the midst of tall pine trees. A small oasis suspended in air where one can feel tranquil.
The hosts were communicative from the get go about setting reasonable expectations from this experience to enjoy it to the fullest. We were assisted by Chandra on our day of visit and she gave my wife and I, a very warm welcome as we got escorted from the entry of driveway to the pinecone. She definitely help reduce our anxiety and get us excited about the stay.
The Pinecone itself is spectacular. The construction and how everything came together is a piece of art in itself. Its a nice spacious place with 360 degree views of the forest. The very slight swinging of the Pinecone as we moved inside or with wind made is feel more connected to the nature.
This place is definitely one of the best tranquil glamping experiences my wife and I ever had. I hope more people get to experience this.

review_text: I really loved staying at the unique Pinecone Treehouse in Bonny Doon....it was exactly what the pictures and description made it sound like, and both Amber and Shannon were very responsive and communicative in the days and hours leading up to our check-in. Amber met us at the gates and showed us around the property--but it was brief and to the point, just the way we like it after a long drive! We loved the peace and quiet of staying in the treehouse and the bathroom/shower amenities were totally fine (in fact, gorgeous to look out into the woods from the open air 'window') for this camping/glamping experience. The treehouse was clean, at night there were lights down below and within the treehouse for easy visibility in getting around. Truly a unique and memorable experience-already so many friends who saw my photos posted online have inquired about details, it's so original and beautifully rendered-from a creative and engineering standpoint...I highly recommend!

review_text:
The pinecone was a truly unique experience. A beautiful camping experience suspended in the trees.
I think itâ€™s important to note that you will be glamping- with a beautiful pinecone in the air, rather than a tent. The bed was cozy, the heated blankets kept us warm, the shower was warm.
Make sure to take any food and drink with you and leave it in you car at the bottom of the tree so you can grab snacks and drinks throughout the day. Only bring what you need for the night in a back pack up into the pinecone. Everything in, everything out.
We were pleasantly surprised that there were Uber that could take us in and out of town. We went out to dinner and then came back to enjoy the beautiful scenery and environment.
Jamie and Shannon were super responsive and helpful when we ran into a couple issues. Over all I would recommend anyone experience it if they get the opportunity.

As other reviewers have stated visiting during the rainy season made the stay even more enchanting, with the clear roof and walls, being able to watch the raindrops come down and hear them as you drift off to sleep ğŸ’¤
We visited during one of Californiaâ€™s famous atmospheric rivers
Highway One was flooded 5-10 feet underwater along the coast with an hour and a half detour and we saw several cars flipped over upside down and accidents in multiple locations on our way to and from so itâ€™s no small wonder with such an intricate structure that there were a few small leaks, which Iâ€™m sure the owners will tend to at the soonest opportunity when the weather clears.

review_text: The Pinecone was a magical experience for us. We planned our stay on a night of full moon, the canopy was bright overnight and the temperature was just perfect. If you are into engineering, you will spend hours understanding the work that went in to building, hoisting and securing such a heavy structure in the canopy. We found it easy to get in and out of the cone via the nautical stair (we are 62&68 years old, super fit). Also, the hosts are very responsive to the guests needs and professional in the way they run their business. It was a once in a lifetime experience worth living, if you are into glamping & treehouses! Make sure to travel light in a small backpack! Lovely!

review_text: As all the other reviews say, sleeping in the trees truly feels like a once in a lifetime experience. Waking up to a circle of trees around us was unforgettable. There was a ton of communication and lots of helpful tips shared with us that made our stay even better. Iâ€™d definitely recommend traveling with your belongings in a backpack for ease of using the ladder and pro tip that we didnâ€™t have service at the gate so it made contacting the host a bit tricky at first - but we had service in the pinecone and the wifi was great so just a heads up for when you arrive at the gate and need to message the host. We got a late start on the morning and they were super friendly and offered a later and very flexible check out time. It was truly a great experience and the hosts were amazing - weâ€™ll definitely never forget our time at the pinecone!

review_text: AMAZING unique once in a lifetime experience and AirBnb. We have been to a lot of treehouses/Hobbit Hole/etc. but this one was hands down the most extraordinary yet! We only stayed one night, but it was such a magical night! Inside the pinecone is so cozy and magical and perfect. The climb up/down was very easy for us and made for such a unique experience. The outdoor shower was amazing, always love getting to shower in the forest! There was a power outage in the area (not the owners fault at all) sometime in the night and into the morning, so our devices did not charge and we had no power all morning and checked out at 11am before it came back, but honestly when you are there things like power are trivial. The nature, the art, the ambience... that is what it is all about. We read and soaked up nature without the need of power. Honestly it does us all well to truly disconnect every now and then and appreciate the other things life has to offer. Also such a short drive to Santa Cruz where we spent an evening out at the amazing restaurants and the next day shopping at all the great shops and enjoying amazing coffee from Verve! We love this area and I would stay over and over again!

And to make it even better it rained in the evening and it was a view beyond words for a rainy night in the woods suspended in a glass pinecone! The morning was a beautiful clear sky and we were mind blown! Youâ€™d be really lucky if you get to experience it all. They had a nice heater to keep us warm throughout. Also do not miss out on the net underneath the structure. Itâ€™s a fun place to hangout too.
The open bath was a cherry on top as if it even needed more. We loved the whole experience. It was a beautiful memorable stay for us, definitely makes up for a special occasion if you want something extraordinary.
Also special thanks to Chandra. My watch had fallen down on the road where I parked and I had lost hopes but she specially went back to check on it and hand delivered it. I cannot thank her enough for the gesture.
Overall it is a wonderful space with wonderful people. I totally recommend going there for an out of the box experience.

review_text:
This is easily the most amazing trip that we have ever been on. The place itself is such an incredible art piece that is a must-see in person, but then getting the chance to stay in it is unbelievable. Climbing the ladder, while daunting at first, is actually a breeze after a couple trips, and we immediately let go of all the fears. We also got the chance to stay in hot, cold, rain, and sun all in one go, and we felt comfortable the whole time. We didnâ€™t even need to use the heater. The only scary thing was that the whole place will rock and spin a bit (not a lot) in the wind, which was jarring at first, but we felt so safe that we almost forgot about after a couple hours. The bathroom is also amazing and looks out into the woods. The hot water gets HOT and you can close class doors to keep the heat in a bit more too making it very comfortable.
Another big thing to note is that while the treehouse is deep enough in the trees to feel secluded, youâ€™re also a very short drive from Santa Cruz. We barely wanted to leave the place, but when we did for food, it was extremely easy to drive out and come back in, and thereâ€™s lots of great restaurants and things to do. And the dirt road up to the treehouse is not long nor hard to drive at all.
Overall, this was a phenomenal experience. We couldnâ€™t ask for anything better!

review_text: My mom and I really enjoyed ourselves. It was magical and such a unique experience that we will forever remember. Hopefully I can bring my son when he turns 18, but then again, he may not want to hang with his mom by then. Your communication was fabulous and dependable. There were a few things that could be leveled up, especially as people are paying a significant amount of money. The heater did not work (and though you offered to replace propane tank in an hour, it was late so not worth the hassle), and the windows could've been cleaned (per my mom). It was 33 degrees overnight, but luckily we wore layers and the comforter was SUPER warm! I understand the windows have since been cleaned and what a tough job that is, but it is also part of the allure . Aesthetically speaking, there were light bulbs missing and a few that didn't work. WE ADORED the bathroom and it was definitely the best shower of my life (so glad I read the reviews because I almost didn't shower). I loved the morning deer visits! Definitely a bucket list trip!! I recommend eating in Santa Cruz and visiting the UC Santa Cruz Botanical garden. THANK YOU!!

Stayed one night
review_text:
A truly unique, amazing experience! Shannon and the team were super responsive and we had a wonderful time. Like other reviews mentioned:
-Make sure you're comfortable with heights and climbing a steep, 30-foot alternating rung ladder. I'm ok with heights and even then was a little nervous on the ladder the first couple of times.
-The bathroom is down the ladder and several feet away - it's not the easiest to reach in the nighttime, so be aware if you're someone who usually wakes up in the night to go to the bathroom.
-don't pack a lot - a backpack is best for going up and down the ladder. I carried both a backpack and food tote and that was just manageable. A suitcase would be really tough.
-Definitely bring long underwear! We stayed on Jan 1 - temps didn't go below freezing, but were just about. It can get cold up there, but Shannon & the team put several heavy blankets on the bed for us, which were super comfy.
All in all, highly recommend!

This is a wonderful, truly unique treehouse experience! The lighting, actual treehouse and decor is stunning!! If you're looking for a "glamping" sort of experience, I would absolutely recommend this place. I would, however, like to add a couple of notes of caution that I hope would help future guests during booking:
- The treehouse has no insulation so assume the temperature inside is the temperature outside
- There is a propane powered small space heater provided but you cannot run it throughout the night so it gets really cold especially since we went in the peak of winter
- The bathroom is very clean and has hot water provided but it is cold in there too. Also, note that there is a compostable toilet provided

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Dustin, and Shannon were kind, friendly, and informative. The communication was detailed and helpful. Kiki was our check in coordinator, who gave us a great and welcoming run down of the treehouse, and Niko, the social media guy, was also friendly and helpful. All 4 staff were kind, welcoming, helpful, friendly, and seemed just as excited for us as we were to stay. The Treehouse is gorgeous!! The directions were easy to follow. We got food recs from the awesome staff, and this is a great, central location to the Wharf, Boardwalk,Downtown, trails, and the college. The views are like no other!! I recommend checking out the YouTube video for a small sample of the beautiful scenery, and to get a visual of how the Treehouse is set up. The designated parking was convenient, the stairs have sandpaper for easier grip, the bed is so so comfy too! Bring extra bedding just in case. There's a heater provided, but we didn't run it all night for safety reasons. The bathroom has a gorgeous view with Earth-friendly features, and the water gets really hot! We especially enjoyed laying in the comfortable bed and being able to see the woods from all angles. The owners are near by, but the local residences are just far enough away that you feel fully immersed in the Redwoods and Pine. The wifi is stable, the provided towels are big and soft, and we really appreciated the head lamps! We loved everything about this PineCone Treehouse. Thanks again, O2 team!

This is a one of a kind stay. Truly special. Feels smaller than it looks but also feels incredibly large. Itâ€™s off a dirt road in a private residence above the UC Santa Cruz campus in Bonny Doons, and it was amazing. Itâ€™s something I checked off my bucket list and donâ€™t think Iâ€™ll ever stay anywhere like this again. Dustin and the o2 team are amazing for having designed this. The place has its rough edges butâ€¦ itâ€™s a pinecone suspended from the trees, youâ€™ll never see/experience anything like it again.
Few things
- if youâ€™re scared of heights, might not be for you. Itâ€™s 30 feet in the air, suspended by 5 wires, and its really stable, but had a friend who came with me that decided they couldnâ€™t sleep there due to the heights, though they visited.
- thereâ€™s one power strip and WiFi, and the shower is absolutely incredibleâ€¦ but when youâ€™re in the pinecone expect some camping conditions outside the bed. There are some bugs/moths/spiders around the area and you need to expect that. Youâ€™re truly in nature and itâ€™s beautiful.
- Thereâ€™s a netting area you can hang out right below the main floor thatâ€™s pretty incredible/comfortable.
- During the day it can be hot, and at night it can be cold. No real windows in the place that open (when I visited), and there isnâ€™t ac/fans etc, so just expect that. Santa Cruz and Bonny Doon are beautiful, go explore during the day - Santa Cruzâ€™ as a city has amazing food and places to visit.
- nighttime + sunrise are incredible to be in the pinecone during. Canâ€™t emphasize that enough.

This place is a true experience. My wife and I spent one night in the Pinecone and it was amazing. The structure is remarkable. I found myself appreciating construction over and over. Once we got comfortable being suspended from trees in a structure that moves, we enjoyed the main area and the â€œhammockâ€ area at the bottom of the Pinecone.
Waking up in the morning and being in the trees was beautiful. My wife said multiple times that she felt like she was in a birds nest.
We were both surprised at how quiet it was. We brought dice and cards and played games on the picnic table i to the night. There are some string lights by the picnic table and in the Pinecone which are nice.
I recommend this place for a unique experience and getaway. You need to be comfortable with climbing the ladder but once you understand how to navigate the stairs, you will love this place.
Thank you for sharing your place with us! Hope we can come back here or stay at another o2 Treehouse property in the future.

Really unique and cool experience. The bed in the trees is incredible, and itâ€™s a joy to wake up to the sounds of the forest while being in a very comfortable bed. The whole experience is thought out and the instructions were very clear.
The room itself is fairly large and feels very safe and sturdy. You canâ€™t really feel it sway that much - when you stand you can see it moving a little bit, but Iâ€™d say itâ€™s significantly less than we anticipated.
The check in process went without a hitch and the host was very welcoming. There were no issues finding the place, and itâ€™s really close to Santa Cruz proper, which was a nice surprise,
Our showers hot water didnâ€™t work for the majority of the stay which was pretty unfortunate, but they said it was due to the propane tank being out of fuel and was fixed the morning we were supposed to check out. Dustin and co gave us a late checkout to allow us to shower. Not being able to shower was fairly frustrating as the cold water was absolutely frigid, so make sure you shower before hand in case it doesnâ€™t work.

review_text:
The pinecone was as amazing as it was from the photos! We took great picture of it just with our phone.
Although the pinecone is made of glass, it was quite stable. The stairs was steep but also a great fun experience to climb up and down! We liked it. Because the room is on the upper part of the pinecone, the windows are facing upward. So other people can barely see the inside from the ground.
We were also lucky to spot deers in the woods.
We do see people got displaced from the fire living nearby. They were quiet and friendly :)
Some small things we found a bit inconvenient - one was that there wasn't hot water. So we wasn't able to take a shower. It was really cold at night, so a hot shower could have been helpful. We wasn't able to connect to wifi but there were cellular signals. Another thing is the compostible toilet. I was sensitive to the smell when opened the hole. But the ventilation of the restroom was great so most of the time it's the fresh smell of the redwoods.

name: Kory
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,

May 2021
,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text:
Loved this location and experience. I'm a sucker for treehouses and very proud to say that I'll be looking forward to attending more treehouses of all types in the near future. This stay was very special for me since my brothers and I use to build our own as kids.
A few tips:
The heater(s) may not work (it didn't for us) so you might want to bring extra clothes.
Bring an extra roll of toilet paper, always have extra.
The road down to the treehouse is drivable for most cars, just go slow and you'll be fine.
The Wi-Fi is spotty at best and it didn't work for us, but it's nature so it won't hurt not having it.
The ladder is best suited for taller people, if you're short you will get that blood flowing.
Make sure the backpack you bring isn't a wide one since it might not fit through the floor hatch/door.
We enjoyed the experience and the architecture of course. If you're doing it for IG... this is for you. If you love nature and glamping... this is for you. Please believe if you're afraid of heights this is most certainly not for you. If you take your time to read the reviews you'll be fine.
!{ory

It took a little bit of skill in the kitchen to prepare some food with limited space and only one burner and the toaster did not work. Over all it was well stocked with pots and pans, silverware and dishes. Everything we needed was available. I would love to stay again, it was wonderful!

review_text: Bucket List - YES !!! We stayed two nights at PVT and LOVED every minute! The location is gorgeous. We drove up from Los Angeles and the last 30 minutes driving past O'Neill Forebay and the San Luis Reservoir and the green hills was such a nice entrance for this scenic getaway. The treehouse is in a small grove of redwoods and looks out over a huge meadow with an incredible view. We enjoyed many hours on the balcony - playing board games, talking, watching hawks circling over the meadow, and soaking up the panoramic view and breathing the fresh air. We wanted to maximize our time in the treehouse, so we brought our food with us. We appreciated the mini fridge, microwave and dishes. We watched movies at night and the heater kept us cozy. We also drove to Mt. Madonna County Park, which was just up the road, and went hiking one weekday. We had the trail to ourselves and were thrilled to hike in the redwoods. PVT is classy! Every detail of PVT was perfect and we hope to return!

We are returning guests at Jackie's beautiful house in Pleasure Point, which should tell you how much we love the home. Jackie has done a fantastic job to offer her home to vacationers. It's the perfect size for us, and is simply a joy to stay in. Coffee in the morning, lunch on the back patio, evening cocktail on the front porch, dinner at the table... walk to the beach... it's all perfect!
The best part of this home is that it's scent-free! So many other vacation homes that we have stayed in stink to high heaven! The overpowering smell of cleaners, air "fresheners", dryer sheets, scented soap, and all kinds of other chemical-based products hit you as soon as you open the door. But not here! Jackie maintains a 100% scent-free home, which is a blessing to people like us that have chemical and fragrance sensitivities. We love that Jackie values these things!
We will certainly be back, and this is the only place that we will stay! Thank you Jackie for being such an angel!

The beach supplies are amazing - we used the beach chairs, beach towels and umbrellas. Bikes, kids toys and wagons looked great as well (though we didn't use them). And it's a great location.
The host sent a text to welcome us and offer to help with anything. And another text the next day to let us know we could ask if we needed anything. So she made it clear she was available but didn't keep texting.
A fabulous stay.

If you're a surfer, you'll realize there is quite nothing like WALKING out of the house with your board and jumping straight into the water. Secondly, the amenities are vast - you've got a place to park your car, a large backyard with a gas grill, firepit, and most importantly a hot outdoor shower. The place has everything to make you feel right at home - super comfy beds, a wine fridge, laundry, and a fully stocked kitchen. We would stay here again in a heartbeat, heck I'd spend my whole summer here if I could!

name: Michael
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
October 2019
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This adorable beach house is so awesome I'm actually afraid to say how good it is because it's bound to become so popular! From the moment we booked, Jackie was proactive in communicating with us. Upon our arrival we checked in with ease and found the house in pristine condition, something that I can attest is extremely rare in Santa Cruz, having lived there for eight years. We were delighted to find a kitchen fully furnished with cookware, utensils, cutlery, dishware and glasses, gas range and oven, dishwasher, nice refrigerator, and a built-in wine and beer fridge under the counter! Modern laundry machines that worked great. TV was set up with streaming services and a sound bar that also had bluetooth connectivity for listening to music from our phones. Comfortable furniture in the living room and two bedrooms with very supportive, comfy beds. Bathroom was very clean and in great condition, with a big rain shower head and plenty of clean towels in the linen closet. Bonus points for the deluxe toilet paper! Radiant heater quickly took the edge off of the morning chill. Several beach cruisers in the garage that we didn't end up using, but all appeared to be in great condition. Nice front porch for relaxing with a couple of comfy chairs. All windows were double pane, opened easily, and latched securely. Wood floors looked original and were in excellent condition. Lots of fun artwork around the house with a beach theme. Ample driveway could likely fit multiple cars, nice to have off street parking. Nice, mellow neighborhood that is two short blocks from Pleasure Point, a very popular local surf spot with a market that has amazing breakfast burritos! I really can't say enough about how wonderful it was to stay in this house. Choose Jackie's Pleasure Point Beach House when you're visiting Santa Cruz!

Rub the lavender and rosemary between your fingers. Feed the friendly koi carp. Or just sit back in your chair by the koi pond and listen to the windchimes thrum in the gentle breezes off Monterey Bay. Highly recommend this place, and look forward to staying again the next time I visit my family in town.

One small cautionary note for travelers, which only applies if you intend to be trekking around the area (like we had to): Lyft / Uber are not terribly present in this part of Santa Cruz, it seems. We had a very difficult time getting timely or reliable pick-ups through either service. To reiterate: we loved the room itself -- just make sure you have your travel well-planned in advance (a rented car might be wisest).

The Zen Garden is in a wonderful location just a couple blocks from West Cliff where you can walk along the ocean and observe wildlife. The room/setting is very comfortable for a single person or couple who do not need a kitchen. There is a coffee/tea set up a small fridge and microwave which worked well for my needs. There is a lovely Koi pond in the yard and the fish greet you every time you walk by. I had an extended stay of more than a month and was very comfortable.
Diana was flexible and checked in periodically to make sure I had everything I needed. I highly recommend you give Zen Garden a try. I certainly would stay again!

review_text:
This is a lovely home. The garden and koi pond is far beyond what I expected. They've really achieved a true sanctuary. The home truly is two blocks from the stunning coastline. Diana and Arthur's AirBnB has many thoughtful touches. They've left chocolate, have a refrigerator, food to feed the fish, coffe and tea, even a Britta filter for water. The bed is very comfortable and there are extra towels if you need them. Light sleepers should install a white noise app or bring noise cancelling head phones. Their home is NOT noisy but the room is connected to the house so there is a bit of natural blending of noises that happens. Parking is free and plentiful and the neighborhood is safe and friendly.
My only true complaint? I did not get to meet their feline guardian... next time!

We felt terrible having to knock on her door and wake her up (she lives next door) but this did eventually allow us to get inside with the correct code. Other than this mishap, all was great. Thank you so much and sorry again for having to wake you up.

This tiny bungalow had everything an individual or couple could need, including impeccable cleanliness and little touches like compost, wall heater, built-in screened windows in the back door for secure cross breeze, powerful shower spray and ready hot water and more. We loved the pool, the nature surrounding it, the thick towels, the towering trees, "shade" umbrellas and solid lawn furniture. We found ourselves refreshed in every possible way. Thank you for opening your home to travelers like us and for helping us make fond memories! I highly recommend Scotts Valley Bungalow.

Itâ€™s a little warmer in Scottâ€™s Valley than SC so bring summer clothes. There is no A/C but the fan works well to cool the room.
